definition: to sweep a grave (and pay one's respects to the dead person)

sentences.english: Tomb-Sweeping Day comes when people go to the tombs of the deceased to pay their respect.
sentences.chinese: 清明节到了，正是给已故的人扫墓上坟的日子。

sentences.english: People pay respects to the dead and clean the graves on the 5th of April.
sentences.chinese: 四月五日，人们扫墓并向过世的人表达敬意。

sentences.english: People visit their ancestors' Graves to sweep away the dirt.
sentences.chinese: 人们到先人的坟头上扫墓。

sentences.english: Each year in Spring Valley it seems that fewer people turn out to celebrate Qingming.
sentences.chinese: 泉沟村每年清明似乎回乡扫墓的人越来越少。

sentences.english: Occasionally, the visitors to the graveyard give me some food, which I take back home.
sentences.chinese: 扫墓者偶然会给我一点食物带回家。

sentences.english: Tomb-sweeping day is a holiday, the traditional ancestor worship activity for grave.
sentences.chinese: 清明节是一个祭祀祖先的节日，传统活动为扫墓。

sentences.english: But he wanted to see the old folk again and to visit my mother's grave.
sentences.chinese: 但是，他想看一看家乡父老乡亲，为我的母亲扫墓。

sentences.english: Affected by the financial tsunami, some grave- sweepers opted for paper suckling pigs as offerings.
sentences.chinese: 受金融海啸影响，有扫墓者选择纸乳猪祭品。

sentences.english: Later, I admitted to the University, the first year has not to grave-sweepers.
sentences.chinese: 后来，我考上大学，第一年也没去扫墓。

sentences.english: This grave, the shrine of the dead an activity.
sentences.chinese: 扫墓俗称上坟，祭奠死者的一种活动。

sentences.english: The Qingming Festival in spring is the occasion for visiting  ancestral graves.
sentences.chinese: 清明节是扫墓拜祭先人的日子。

sentences.english: Chinese being  practical people this sweeping of the graves is given an extended period, that is, 10 days before and after Qing Ming day.
sentences.chinese: 扫墓活动通常是在清明节的前十天或后十天。

sentences.english: Over time, Hanshi Day was replaced with tomb-sweeping day.
sentences.chinese: 随着时间的推移，寒食节被清明扫墓所代替了。

sentences.english: On the Pure Brightness Festival, people visit family tombs or go to mausoleums of revolutionary martyrs.
sentences.chinese: 人们在清明节去扫墓，或去祭扫革命烈士墓。

sentences.english: Qing Ming is a ancestor worship festival, traditional activities for the grave.
sentences.chinese: 清明节是一个祭祀祖先的节日，传统活动为扫墓。

sentences.english: Every year in April to clear when, we have to drive back home early graves.
sentences.chinese: 每年四月清明的时候，我们都要起早驱车回老家扫墓。

definition: Qingming or Pure Brightness Festival or Tomb Sweeping Day, celebration for the dead (in early April)
to worship/to observe religious rites/to pay one's respects (to one's ancestors etc)
to offer sacrifices to one's ancestors
to burn paper offerings (as part of religious ceremony)
to go home to visit one's family
to offer sacrifices (to one's ancestors)/to hold or attend a memorial service
lit. tread the green; go for a walk in the spring (when the grass has turned green)/spring hike season around Qingming festival 清明, 4th-6th April
